history.content:
That is correct.

I don't think they even let you P/NP an technical upper division course even if you don't need it for any requirements.

~~~

^that maybe true for EECS( not sure) but you can do so for L&S CS

~~~

For EECS:  http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/deadlines:

During the final semester, if a student is on the official degree list they may take technical courses on a P/NP basis if the courses are not required for graduation. The deadline for a graduating senior to elect to take a technical course P/NP is Friday of the fifth week of instruction. Graduating seniors may not change a technical course to P/NP after the fifth week for any reason.

That is correct.

I don't think they even let you P/NP an technical upper division course even if you don't need it for any requirements.

~~~

^that maybe true for EECS( not sure) but you can do so for L&S CS

Student answer is correct for LSCS. Please make sure you've taken or planned for enough letter graded UD courses before making this change. 

EECS students may not change tech courses to P/NP.
If we PNP an upper div course, it wouldn't count as one of the requirements for the CS major right? Only letter grade courses classes are counted?
